comments.body: my nickel - we shouldn't be keeping around 'prior to version x.y' for something that old.
I agree in general, but in this case someone might be trying to update an old playbook that has `always_run` in it, and searching the docs to find out what the modern equivalent is.

@@ -1,1 +46,50 @@Running single tasks with ``check_mode: yes`` can be useful for testing Ansible modules, either to test the module itself or to test the conditions under which a module would make changes. You can register variables (see :ref:`playbooks_conditionals`) on these tasks for even more detail on the potential changes.

.. note:: Prior to version 2.2 only the equivalent of ``check_mode: no`` existed. The notation for that was ``always_run: yes``.
